### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Ross Geller: red fleece jacket - dark pants - short, dark hair - concerned
Chandler Bing: white cable-knit sweater - dark pants - dark, styled hair - serious
Rachel Green: light-colored top - dark pants - long, brown hair - surprised
Phoebe Buffay: dark top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - animated
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket - jeans - dark, styled hair - surprised

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is gathered in the living room, seated around a coffee table with food and drinks. Monica stands near the kitchen area, while Ross sits on the couch eating. Chandler sits nearby, also eating. Phoebe stands near the window, gesturing excitedly. Joey stands near the couch, looking toward the window. Rachel sits on the couch, looking toward the window. The group collectively reacts with shock and surprise as they look out the window together.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee table: wooden, with food and drinks on it
- Couch: white, with patterned pillows
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets on it
- Lamp: wooden base, striped shade
- Window: large, with black frames
- Picture frame: on shelf, with deer image

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses a creepy person with a telescope outside, expressing feeling violated. The group reacts with shock and amusement as they all look out the window together. The conversation has a tense, then joking tone, with Rachel appearing alarmed and the others reacting with surprise and laughter.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe moves to the window and gestures excitedly
Joey stands up and moves toward the couch
Ross stands up and moves toward the window
Chandler stands up and moves toward the window
The group collectively looks out the window
chunk_00001.subtitles: I can't believe you would actually say that. I would much rather be Mr. Peanut than Mr. Salty. No way. Mr. Salty is a sailor, all right? He's gotta be, like, the toughest snack there is. I don't know. You don't wanna mess with corn nuts. They're crazy. Oh, my God. Oh, my God. You gotta come see this. There's some creep out there with a telescope. [RACHEL GASPS] I can't believe it. He's looking right at us. Oh, that is so sick. I feel violated. And not in a good way. How can people do that? [ALL GROANING AND SCOFFING] Oh, you guys, look. Ugly Naked Guy got gravity boots.

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a first date with Monica, mentioning how it was "unbelievable" and that they "could totally be themselves." Monica responds with excitement, while Chandler and Joey react with amusement. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Ross appearing serious and Monica animated.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross moves from standing near the counter to sitting on the couch. Monica gestures with her hands while speaking. Chandler leans back in his chair. Joey sets down his coffee mug.
chunk_00002.subtitles: I'm telling you, years from now, school children will study it... ...as one of the greatest first dates of all time. It was unbelievable. We could totally be ourselves. We didn't have to play any games. - So have you called her yet? - Let her know I like her? Are you insane? Guys. It's gross. It's the next day. How needy do I wanna seem?

chunk_00003.subtitles: It's the next day. How needy do I wanna seem? I'm right. Right? - Let her dangle. - Yeah, definitely. Oh. I can't believe my parents are pressuring me... ...to find one of you people. God. Come on. Just do it. Call her. Stop being so testosterone-y. Which, by the way, is the real San Francisco treat. - I got her machine. - Her answering machine? No, interestingly enough, her leaf blower picked up. So, um, why didn't you say anything? Oh, no, no, no. Last time I left a spontaneous message... ...I ended up using the phrase, "Yes, indeed-io." MONICA: Look, it's Rachel and Barry. No, no, don't everybody look at once. - Okay, okay. What's going on? - Okay, they're just talking. Yeah, well, does he look upset? Does he look like he was just told to shove anything? No. No, actually, he's smiling.

chunk_00005.subtitles: It was comfortable and it was familiar. It was just nice. That's "nice" twice. Rachel, what's going on? Isn't this the same Barry who you left at the altar? Duh. Where have you been? Yeah, but it was different with him today. He wasn't, like, Orthodontist Guy, you know? I mean, we had fun. Is there anything wrong with that? Yes. - Why? - I have my reasons. Okay, how about the fact that he's engaged to another woman... ...who just happens to be your ex-best friend? All right. All right, all right, all right. I know it's stupid. chunk_00010.subtitles: Uh, Rach. How come you have dental floss in your hair? Oh, do I? We ended up having sex in his chair. You had sex in his chair? I said that a little too loudly, didn't I? It's nothing like me and Carol. Please. If she said to you, "Ross, I want you on this couch... ...right here, right now," what would you say? If it helps I could slide over. chunk_00013.subtitles: Thanks, but I gotta go to work and get my eyes scratched out by Mindy. Relax. She may not even know. Please, I haven't heard from her in seven months, and now she calls me. I mean, what else is it about? She was my best friend, you guys. We went to camp together... ...she taught me how to kiss... - Yeah? Now, you know, I'm, like, the other woman. - Ugh, I feel so... - Naughty. - I'll see you guys later. - I'll walk out with you. When she taught you to kiss, you were at camp... ...and were you wearing any kind of little uniform or...? That's fine, yeah. Okay, I'm gonna go the bathroom. Will you watch my phone? - Why don't you just take it with you? - Hey. We haven't been on a second date. She needs to hear me pee? Why don't you just call her? I can't call her. I left a message. I have some pride. - Do you? - No.
